ground_truth: The boy's mouth turns down, and he sulks silently, staring blankly ahead. Behind him, the door opens, and a woman enters. She pauses, hands on hips, then walks towards him. They are both reflected in the curved screen of an old TV, so the edges of the room look distorted. She stands beside him, arms folded. The woman crouches beside the boy, looking into his face. The boy turns and looks at her. She stands and folds her arms again. He's hunched forward, head down. The boy lifts his head. The boy goes to the window. Outside in the sunshine, children are playing in a park with a high chain-link fence. An oblong box with purple wrapping is propped on the seat of a bench facing him. Children chase past the bench, as the boy walks slowly towards it, holding on to the fencing for support as he negotiates the two steps down into the park. He sits on the bench and picks up the purple package with his good right hand, undoes the white ribbon around it, and tears at the paper. Inside is a brown cardboard box. The boy pulls off the lid, folds back purple tissue paper, and stares down. In the box is a comic, upside down. Very carefully, the boy turns the comic around on its bed of purple tissue. The cover features a heroic figure in a yellow cape fighting a powerfully built creature, half-man, half-beast, against a backdrop of New York skyscrapers. The woman sits gently beside the boy. The boy continues to stare down at the comic. She looks away and back at him. He glances up at her for a moment. As he looks down again, the words and colors fade, leaving a more detailed black and white version of the comic cover. The dark-haired young man in a suit and tie, whose face is reflected in the glass over the drawing, nods. The young man grins. Elijah limps across the gallery using a cane. Elijah turns back to stare at the man. As he does, David strides towards the gallery with Joseph a few paces behind. Inside, Elijah is walking away from the door and doesn't look around. Elijah turns. They're sitting in an office. Joseph gazes up at his father. Joseph looks from David to Elijah, then gets up and goes. Elijah, in a shimmering, purple, silk suit, gazes at David. David looks around as Joseph returns. David is sitting up on a bed, a pillow behind his head, reading the paper. Joseph is asleep, lying across him, his head on David's chest, one arm flung around him. David lowers the paper and glances at his son. He closes the paper and very carefully slides out from under the sleeping boy.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: The lad's lips turns downwards, and he broods wordlessly, gazing vacantly forward. Behind him, the portal opens, and a lady enters. She hesitates, hands on waist, then strides towards him. They are both mirrored in the curved display of an ancient TV, so the boundaries of the chamber appear warped. She stands next to him, limbs crossed. The lady crouches beside the lad, peering into his visage. The lad turns and gazes at her. She stands and crosses her limbs again. He's hunched forward, head lowered. The lad raises his head. The lad goes to the pane. Outside in the daylight, youngsters are playing in a playground with a tall chain-link barrier. An elongated box with violet covering is propped on the seat of a bench facing him. Youngsters race past the bench, as the lad strolls leisurely towards it, gripping on to the fence for steadiness as he navigates the two steps down into the playground. He sits on the bench and picks up the violet parcel with his good right hand, undoes the white bow around it, and rips at the paper. Inside is a brown paperboard box. The lad pulls off the lid, folds back violet tissue paper, and gazes down. In the box is a comic, inverted. Very gingerly, the lad turns the comic around on its cushion of violet tissue. The cover showcases a valiant figure in a yellow cloak battling a powerfully built entity, half-man, half-beast, against a backdrop of New York skyscrapers. The lady sits softly beside the lad. The lad continues to gaze down at the comic. She looks away and back at him. He glances up at her for a moment. As he looks down again, the words and colors fade, leaving a more intricate black and white version of the comic cover. The dark-haired young male in a suit and tie, whose visage is mirrored in the glass over the illustration, nods. The young male beams. Elijah limps across the gallery using a cane. Elijah turns back to gaze at the male. As he does, David strides towards the gallery with Joseph a few steps behind. Inside, Elijah is strolling away from the door and doesn't look around. Elijah turns. They're sitting in a bureau. Joseph gazes up at his sire. Joseph looks from David to Elijah, then rises and departs. Elijah, in a shimmering, purple, silk suit, gazes at David. David looks around as Joseph returns. David is sitting up on a bed, a cushion behind his head, reading the newspaper. Joseph is asleep, lying across him, his head on David's chest, one limb flung around him. David lowers the newspaper and glances at his offspring. He closes the newspaper and very gingerly slides out from under the slumbering lad.

She pauses, hands on hips, then the boy is walked towards by her. They are both reflecting in the curved screen of an old TV, so the edges of the room are looked at by them distorted. She is stood beside him, arms folded. The woman is crouched beside the boy, looking into his face. He turns and looks at her. She is stood and folds her arms again. He's hunched forward, head down. His head is lifted by the boy. The window is gone to by the boy. Outside in the sunshine, children play in a park with a high chain-link fence. An oblong box with purple wrapping is propped on the seat of a bench facing him. The bench is chased past by children, as he is walked slowly towards by the boy, holding on to the fencing for support as the two steps are negotiated by him down into the park. The bench is sat on by him, and the purple package is picked up with his good right hand, the white ribbon around it is undone by him, and the paper is torn at by him. Inside is a brown cardboard box. The lid is pulled off by the boy, purple tissue paper is folded back by him, and he stares down. In the box is a comic, turned upside down by the boy. Very carefully, the comic is turned around by the boy on its bed of purple tissue. The cover features a heroic figure in a yellow cape fighting a powerfully built creature, half-man, half-beast, against a backdrop of New York skyscrapers. The woman is sat gently beside the boy. He continues to stare down at the comic. Her gaze is turned away and back to him. A glance is given at her by him for a moment. As he looks down again, the words and colors are faded, leaving a more detailed black and white version of the comic cover. The dark-haired young man in a suit and tie, whose face the glass over the drawing reflects, nods. A grin is given by the young man. Elijah is limped across the gallery using a cane. The man is stared back at by Elijah. As he does, David is strode towards the gallery by him with Joseph a few paces behind. Inside, Elijah walks away from the door and doesn't look around. He turns. They're sitting in an office. Joseph is gazed up at his father. Joseph looks from David to Elijah, then gets up and goes. Elijah, in a shimmering, purple, silk suit, is gazed at David. David's gaze is directed around as Joseph returns. David is sat up on a bed, a pillow behind his head, reading the paper. Joseph is asleep, lying across him, his head on David's chest, one arm is flung around him. The paper is lowered by David and a glance is given at his son. He closes the paper and very carefully slides out from under the sleeping boy.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: The boy sulks silently, staring ahead. A woman enters, pauses, and approaches him. Their reflections distort in an old TV's curved screen. She stands beside him, arms folded, then crouches to meet his gaze. The boy heads to the window. Outside, children play in a park with a chain-link fence. An oblong, purple-wrapped box rests on a bench. Children chase by as he walks to the bench, supporting himself on the fence. He sits, opens the package with his right hand, revealing a cardboard box. He opens it to find a comic, upside down, featuring a hero in a yellow cape battling a creature against NYC skyscrapers. The woman sits beside him. He stares at the comic, which changes to black and white. A young man in a suit nods and grins, then limps across the gallery with a cane. Elijah turns to see David approaching with Joseph behind. Inside, Elijah doesn't look back. In an office, Joseph looks between David and Elijah, then leaves. Elijah, in a purple silk suit, gazes at David. David sits up in bed, reading, with Joseph asleep on his chest. Carefully, David slides out from under the sleeping boy.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: The boy sulks silently, staring blankly. A woman enters, pauses with hands on hips, then approaches him. They are reflected in a distorted TV screen. She crouches beside him, and he looks at her, then goes to the window. Outside, children play. The boy walks to a bench with a purple-wrapped box, opens it, and finds a comic. The cover shows a hero battling a beast. The woman sits beside him; he glances at her, then back at the comic, which fades to black and white. A young man in a suit nods and grins. Elijah limps with a cane, turns, and sees David and Joseph approaching. In an office, Joseph leaves. Elijah, in a purple suit, gazes at David. At home, David reads in bed with Joseph sleeping on him. David lowers the paper and carefully slides out from under his son.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: The corners of the boy’s mouth curve downward, and he sinks into a sulking silence, his expression blank as he stares listlessly ahead. Suddenly, there comes a sound from behind him as the door swings open, and a woman makes her entrance. She stops in place briefly, hands akimbo, before she strides purposefully toward him. Both of their reflections appear in the curved glass of an old television screen, where the edges of the room have a distorted, almost funhouse mirror quality. She positions herself beside the boy, arms folded across her chest with a sense of determination. Gently, she crouches down next to the boy, peering into his expressionless face in search of understanding. The boy slowly turns his head to look back at her. Then, she rises, folding her arms once more in a familiar gesture. With his shoulders hunched forward and his head bowed, the boy appears burdened by his thoughts. Gradually, he lifts his head again and moves toward the window. Through the glass, under the bright sunshine, children are gleefully playing in a park enclosed by a high chain-link fence. On a bench facing him, an oblong box draped in vibrant purple wrapping rests enticingly. As the children dash energetically past the bench, the boy makes his way to it, gripping the fencing for support as he carefully navigates the two small steps that lead him down into the park. Settling onto the bench, he reaches for the purple package with his good right hand, methodically unties the white ribbon binding it, and begins to tear at the wrapping paper with anticipation. Nestled inside is a plain brown cardboard box. Curiously, he removes the lid, folds back the protective purple tissue paper, and gazes down at its contents. There, nestled in the box, is a comic book, albeit upside down. With deliberate care, the boy rotates the comic on its bed of purple tissue paper. The cover vividly depicts a valiant figure clad in a dynamic yellow cape, locked in combat with a formidable creature that is part man, part beast, all set against the iconic skyscraper backdrop of New York City. The woman gently sits down beside him, offering silent companionship. The boy remains absorbed, his eyes fixed on the comic. She turns her gaze away and then back at him, while he momentarily glances up at her. As his focus returns to the comic, the colors and words gently fade, transforming into a detailed black and white version of the cover’s illustration. In the gallery, the glass reflects the face of a young man with dark hair, dressed sharply in a suit and tie, who nods knowingly. This young man then breaks into a grin. Meanwhile, Elijah makes his way across the gallery, his steps aided by a cane. He pauses to turn and take another look at the man, just as David confidently strides toward the gallery entrance, Joseph following a few steps behind. Inside, Elijah moves away from the door, his attention seemingly elsewhere. But then he turns back. They find themselves seated in an office, where Joseph looks up at his father with a contemplative expression. Joseph's eyes shift from David to Elijah, and then he rises and departs. Elijah, resplendent in a shimmering purple silk suit, regards David thoughtfully. David surveys the surroundings as Joseph makes his return. Comfortably propped up on a bed with a pillow supporting his back, David is absorbed in reading the newspaper. Joseph is sound asleep, sprawled across him, his head gently resting on David’s chest, one arm draped around him in peaceful slumber. David slowly lowers the newspaper and tenderly glances at his sleeping son. Carefully, he folds the paper closed and gingerly slides out from beneath the boy, taking great care not to disturb his rest.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: The corners of the young boy’s mouth curve downward into a distinct frown, and he sinks deep into a moody, sulking silence, his expression remaining blank as he stares listlessly into the distance ahead. Out of nowhere, there comes a sound from behind him as the door swings open with a gentle creak, and a woman makes her entrance into the room. She pauses momentarily in place, hands poised confidently on her hips, before she strides purposefully in the direction of the boy. Both of their reflections become visible in the curved glass of an old television screen, where the edges of the room possess a distorted, almost funhouse mirror quality, adding a surreal touch. She positions herself beside the boy, arms folded resolutely across her chest with a noticeable sense of determination. With a gentle, caring demeanor, she crouches down next to the boy, peering into his expressionless face, searching for any hints of understanding. The boy, slowly and deliberately, turns his head to meet her gaze. Then, she rises with a familiar grace, folding her arms once more in that well-known gesture. With his shoulders hunched forward and his head bowed down, the boy appears as though he is burdened by the weight of his thoughts. Gradually, he lifts his head again and moves toward the window to catch another view. Through the glass, under the bright sunshine, children are gleefully playing in a lively park enclosed by a high chain-link fence. On a bench directly facing him, an oblong box draped in vibrant purple wrapping rests enticingly, like a gift waiting to be discovered. As the children dash energetically past the bench, the boy makes his way toward it, gripping the fencing for support as he carefully navigates the two small steps that lead him down into the inviting park. Settling himself onto the bench, he reaches eagerly for the purple package with his good right hand, methodically untying the white ribbon that binds it, and begins to tear at the wrapping paper with a sense of mounting anticipation. Nestled within is a plain brown cardboard box, an unassuming treasure. Curiously, he removes the lid, folds back the layers of protective purple tissue paper, and gazes down intently at its contents. There, snugly nestled in the box, is a comic book, albeit placed upside down. With deliberate care, the boy rotates the comic on its bed of luxurious purple tissue paper. The cover vividly portrays a valiant figure, heroically clad in a dynamic yellow cape, engaged in fierce combat with a formidable creature, part man, part beast, all set against the iconic skyscraper backdrop of bustling New York City. The woman gently sits down beside him, offering her silent companionship. The boy remains absorbed, his eyes firmly fixed on the comic. She turns her gaze away momentarily and then returns it to him, while he briefly glances up at her. As his focus returns to the comic, the colors, and words gently fade, transforming into a detailed black and white version of the cover’s illustration. In the art gallery, the glass reflects the face of a young man with dark hair, dressed sharply in an immaculate suit and tie, who nods knowingly. This young man then breaks into a warm grin. Meanwhile, Elijah makes his way purposefully across the gallery, his steps aided by a supportive cane. He pauses to turn and take another look at the man, just as David confidently strides toward the gallery entrance, with Joseph following a few steps behind. Inside, Elijah moves away from the door, his attention seemingly directed elsewhere. But then he turns back. They find themselves seated in an office, where Joseph looks up at his father with a contemplative expression on his face. Joseph's eyes shift from David to Elijah, and then he rises and departs from the room. Elijah, resplendent in a shimmering purple silk suit, regards David thoughtfully. David, in turn, surveys the surroundings as Joseph makes his return. Comfortably propped up on a bed with a plush pillow supporting his back, David is absorbed in reading the day's newspaper. Joseph is sound asleep, sprawled across him, his head gently resting on David’s chest, one arm draped around him in peaceful slumber. David slowly lowers the newspaper and tenderly glances down at his sleeping son. Carefully, he folds the paper closed and gingerly slides out from beneath the boy, taking great care not to disturb his rest.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: The boy's mouth gradually turns downward, and he begins to sulk silently, directing his gaze blankly ahead without registering his surroundings. Behind him, a subtle noise signals the door opening, and a woman steps inside, takes a momentary pause, and places her hands on her hips as she assesses the room. After a brief hesitation, she moves with purpose towards the boy. Their reflections appear distorted in the curved screen of an old TV, making the edges of the room seem warped. Reaching his side, she stands with her arms folded. She then lowers herself into a crouch beside the boy, attempting to engage him by looking directly into his face. Slowly, he turns his head to meet her gaze with a fleeting look of acknowledgment. She rises once more, refolding her arms across her chest as she observes him. The boy remains hunched forward, his head hanging low, but then he gradually lifts his head in a thoughtful gesture. Deciding to change his focus, he moves towards the window. Through the glass, he surveys the scene outside, where sunshine floods a park enclosed by a high chain-link fence, and children are energetically playing. Capturing his attention is an oblong box with purple wrapping, which is conspicuously perched on the seat of a bench facing him. As children run and chase each other past the bench, the boy, with intentional slowness, makes his way towards it. He uses the fence for support, carefully negotiating the two steps down into the vibrant park. Upon reaching the bench, he sits down and gently picks up the purple package with his capable right hand, then methodically loosens the white ribbon that secures it, before pulling apart the wrapping paper. Inside is a plain brown cardboard box; the boy removes the lid, folds back the purple tissue paper lining, and gazes down intently. Nestled within the box is a comic book, currently positioned upside down. With deliberate care, he rotates the comic on its cushion of purple tissue paper. The cover reveals a dramatic scene featuring a heroic figure in a striking yellow cape engaged in battle against a powerful creature that is both man and beast, with the iconic New York skyscrapers providing a dramatic backdrop. The woman gently sits beside the boy, offering silent companionship. He remains transfixed by the comic, absorbing its imagery, while she steals glances away and back at him. Briefly, he lifts his eyes to meet hers, establishing a momentary connection before returning his focus to the comic. As he does so, the vibrant words and colors of the comic begin to fade, transitioning into a more intricate black-and-white version of the cover. In another setting, within the reflective surface of the glass over a drawing, a dark-haired young man wearing a suit and tie nods approvingly, his expression shifting into a grin. Meanwhile, Elijah is observed limping through a gallery, relying on his cane for stability as he moves. He turns back, fixing his gaze on the man with scrutiny. Concurrently, David, walking with confident strides, approaches the gallery entrance, trailed by Joseph a few steps behind. Inside, Elijah is seen heading away from the door, paying no attention to his surroundings. He pauses and turns. In a different setting, they are seated together in an office. Joseph looks up at his father, seeking unspoken communication through his gaze. His eyes shift from David to Elijah before he decides to rise and leave the room. Elijah, adorned in a shimmering, purple, silk suit, continues to observe David. David scans the room contemplatively as Joseph makes his return. Transitioning to a more intimate scene, David is positioned upright on a bed, with a pillow propped behind him, leisurely reading a newspaper. Joseph lies asleep across him, his small head resting on David's chest, one arm draped affectionately around him. With tender care, David lowers the newspaper and casts a glance at his son, absorbed in the peaceful moment. He then closes the paper and, with utmost caution, delicately maneuvers himself out from under the slumbering boy, ensuring not to disturb his rest.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: The boy sulks silently, gazing blankly ahead as a woman enters the room and approaches him. Their distorted reflections are visible on the old TV's curved screen. She crouches beside him for a moment of eye contact, stands again with folded arms, and the boy, hunched forward, eventually lifts his head to look at her. He moves to the window, observing children playing in the sunlit park. A purple-wrapped box sits on a bench outside. The boy navigates down a few steps, holding the fence for support, and approaches the bench. He sits, opens the package with his good hand, and discovers an upside-down comic in a brown box. Carefully correcting its orientation, he examines a cover depicting a hero in a yellow cape fighting a beast in a cityscape. The woman joins him and he glances at her momentarily before focusing back on the comic, which transitions to a detailed black-and-white version. Meanwhile, a dark-haired young man’s reflection nods approvingly in the glass. Elijah, using a cane, crosses a gallery and notices David striding in with Joseph following. Elijah turns as the scene shifts to an office where Joseph, alongside his father, gets up and leaves. Elijah, in a shimmering suit, gazes at David, who looks around upon Joseph's return. Later, David reads the paper in bed with a sleeping Joseph resting against him. Carefully, David sets aside the paper and slides out from under his son.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: The boy's mouth turns down, and he sulks silently, staring blankly ahead as if lost in thought. Behind him, the door opens, and a woman, who appears tired from a long day of work, enters. She pauses, hands on hips, then walks towards him with the air of someone used to handling such situations. They are both reflected in the curved screen of an old TV, a relic from the 1980s when such screens were common, so the edges of the room look distorted. She stands beside him, arms folded in a manner suggesting she's about to broach an important subject. The woman crouches beside the boy, looking into his face with concern. The boy turns and looks at her, searching for comfort. She stands and folds her arms again, a universal gesture of impatience mixed with affection. He's hunched forward, head down, seemingly burdened by his thoughts. The boy lifts his head as if making a decision. The boy goes to the window, drawn by the sound of children outside. Outside in the sunshine, children are playing in a park with a high chain-link fence, typical of urban playgrounds designed for safety. An oblong box with purple wrapping, enticing and mysterious, is propped on the seat of a bench facing him. Children chase past the bench, laughing and shouting, as the boy walks slowly towards it, holding on to the fencing for support as he negotiates the two steps down into the park, careful of his injury. He sits on the bench and picks up the purple package with his good right hand, undoes the white ribbon around it, and tears at the paper with eager anticipation. Inside is a brown cardboard box, plain and unassuming. The boy pulls off the lid, folds back purple tissue paper, and stares down in surprise. In the box is a comic, upside down, a rare first edition of a popular series from the 1970s. Very carefully, the boy turns the comic around on its bed of purple tissue. The cover features a heroic figure in a yellow cape fighting a powerfully built creature, half-man, half-beast, against a backdrop of New York skyscrapers, reminiscent of classic superhero tales set in iconic cities. The woman sits gently beside the boy, offering silent support. The boy continues to stare down at the comic, perhaps recalling a fond memory attached to it. She looks away and back at him, understanding his mixed emotions. He glances up at her for a moment, seeking reassurance. As he looks down again, the words and colors fade, leaving a more detailed black and white version of the comic cover, as if echoing a shift to a more serious theme. The dark-haired young man in a suit and tie, whose face is reflected in the glass over the drawing, nods, acknowledging the change. The young man grins with satisfaction at the transformation. Elijah, who has a noticeable limp from an old sports injury, limps across the gallery using a cane, an essential accessory for him. Elijah turns back to stare at the man, pondering his presence. As he does, David strides towards the gallery with Joseph a few paces behind, both dressed in business attire that suggests a day at the office. Inside, Elijah is walking away from the door and doesn't look around, immersed in thought. Elijah turns, catching sight of his surroundings. They're sitting in an office resembling a lawyer's chamber. Joseph gazes up at his father, admiration in his eyes. Joseph looks from David to Elijah, then gets up and goes, as if prompted by an unspoken request. Elijah, in a shimmering, purple, silk suit that catches the light, gazes at David, assessing him. David looks around as Joseph returns, acknowledging him with a nod. David is sitting up on a bed, a pillow behind his head, reading the paper, an old habit of his. Joseph is asleep, lying across him, his head on David's chest, one arm flung around him in a gesture of trust. David lowers the paper and glances at his son with a gentle smile. He closes the paper and very carefully slides out from under the sleeping boy, ensuring he doesn't wake him.

test_cases.name: Addition (~50%)
test_cases.description: The boy's mouth turns down and he sulks silently staring blankly ahead. Behind him the door opens and a woman enters. She pauses hands on hips then walks towards him. They are both reflected in the curved screen of an old TV so the edges of the room look distorted. She stands beside him arms folded. The woman crouches beside the boy looking into his face. The boy turns and looks at her. She stands and folds her arms again. He is hunched forward head down. The boy lifts his head. The boy goes to the window. Outside in the sunshine children are playing in a park with a high chainlink fence. An oblong box with purple wrapping is propped on the seat of a bench facing him. Children chase past the bench as the boy walks slowly towards it holding on to the fencing for support as he negotiates the two steps down into the park. He sits on the bench and picks up the purple package with his good right hand undoes the white ribbon around it and tears at the paper. Inside is a brown cardboard box. The boy pulls off the lid folds back purple tissue paper and stares down. In the box is a comic upside down. Very carefully the boy turns the comic around on its bed of purple tissue. The cover features a heroic figure in a yellow cape fighting a powerfully built creature. halfman halfbeast against a backdrop of New York skyscrapers. The woman sits gently beside the boy. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. He sits on the planter and picks up the gold package with his good right hand, unties the blue string around it, and tears at the paper. Inside is a gray metal box. The boy pulls off the lid, folds back gold tissue paper, and stares down. In the box is a photograph, upside down. Very carefully, the boy turns the photograph around on its bed of gold tissue. The image features a heroic figure in a green cloak fighting a powerfully built creature, half-bird, half-fish, against a backdrop of Tokyo skyscrapers. The woman sits gently beside the boy. The boy continues to stare down at the photograph. She looks away and back at him. He glances up at her for a moment. As he looks down again, the details and colors fade, leaving a more detailed black and white version of the photograph image. test_cases.name: Action Corruption
test_cases.description: The boy's mouth curves up, and he chuckles silently, gazing brightly ahead. Behind him, the door swings open, and a woman skips in. She halts, hands on hips, then skips towards him. They are both captured in the curved screen of an old TV, so the edges of the room appear twisted. She kneels beside him, arms stretched. The woman jumps beside the boy, peering into his face. The boy spins and peeks at her. She leaps and waves her arms again. He's lying backward, head up. The boy lowers his head. The boy floats to the window. Outside in the sunshine, children are dancing in a park with a high chain-link fence. An oblong box with purple wrapping is balanced on the seat of a bench facing him. Children tumble past the bench, as the boy sprints slowly towards it, clinging to the fencing for support as he glides over the two steps down into the park. He stands on the bench and touches the purple package with his good right hand, tightens the white ribbon around it, and smooths the paper. Inside is a green cardboard box. The boy pushes off the lid, unfurls purple tissue paper, and glances down. In the box is a comic, right-side up. Very carefully, the boy flips the comic over on its bed of purple tissue. The cover features a heroic figure in a yellow cape embracing a powerfully built creature, half-man, half-beast, against a vista of New York skyscrapers. The woman hops gently beside the boy. The boy continues to glance down at the comic. She peers away and back at him. He flickers up at her for a moment. As he looks down again, the words and colors blend, revealing a more detailed black and white version of the comic cover. The dark-haired young man in a suit and tie, whose face is reflected in the glass over the drawing, shakes his head. The young man frowns. Elijah dances across the gallery using a cane. Elijah spins back to glance at the man. As he does, David strolls towards the gallery with Joseph a few paces behind. Inside, Elijah is pacing away from the door and doesn't glance around. Elijah wiggles. They're lounging in an office. Joseph stares up at his father. Joseph peers from David to Elijah, then sits down and stays. Elijah, in a shimmering, purple, silk suit, peers at David. David scans around as Joseph departs. David is lying down on a bed, a pillow beneath his head, studying the paper. Joseph is awake, lying across him, his head on David's chest, one arm hanging around him. David raises the paper and peers at his son. He opens the paper and very quickly slides out from under the waking boy.

The cover features a majestic figure in a green cape fighting a powerfully built machine, half-robot, half-human, against a backdrop of London bridges. The puzzle sits gently beside the cat. test_cases.name: Subject-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: The cat's whiskers twitch, and it paces silently, gazing blankly ahead. Behind it, the window slides, and a dog saunters in. It halts, paws crossed, then hops towards the cat. They are both mirrored in the shiny surface of an old mirror, so the corners of the room appear warped. It perches beside the cat, tail wrapped. The dog squats beside the cat, peering into its eyes. The cat swivels and glances at it. The dog leaps and wraps its tail again. It's crouched low, paws tucked. The cat raises its feet. The cat leaps to the balcony. Outside in the moonlight, birds are soaring in a meadow with a tall wooden fence. A round ball with green wrapping is perched on the edge of a fountain facing it. Birds swoop past the fountain, as the cat trots slowly towards it, clutching the railing for balance as it maneuvers the single step down into the meadow. It lounges on the fountain and lifts the green package with its sturdy left paw, untangles the black string around it, and rips at the covering. Inside is a gray metal crate. The cat flips off the top, unfolds green fabric lining, and peers down. In the crate is a leaflet, upside down. Very gingerly, the cat turns the leaflet around on its bed of green fabric. The cover displays a daring character in a red cloak battling a formidable robot, half-machine, half-droid, against a backdrop of London bridges. The dog lounges gently beside the cat. The cat keeps peering down at the leaflet. It gazes away and back at it. It peeks up at the dog for a moment. As it glances down again, the images and shapes fade, revealing a more intricate black and white version of the leaflet cover. The blonde young woman in a dress and hat, whose profile is reflected in the glass over the artwork, nods. The young woman chuckles. Emma shuffles across the corridor using a crutch. Emma swivels back to peer at the woman. As she does, Oliver marches towards the corridor with George a few steps behind. Outside, Emma is drifting away from the entry and doesn't glance back. Emma swivels. They're lounging in a lounge. George peers up at his mother. George glances from Oliver to Emma, then stands up and strolls. Emma, in a glowing, green, velvet dress, peers at Oliver. Oliver gazes around as George returns. Oliver is reclining on a couch, a cushion behind his feet, perusing the magazine. George is dozing, lying across him, his foot on Oliver's shoulder, one leg flung around him. Oliver folds the magazine and very gingerly lifts out from under the resting cat.

test_cases.name: Object-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: The boy's nose scrunches up, and he pouts quietly, gazing absently upwards. Behind him, the window slides, and a man slips inside. He halts, arms akimbo, then skips towards him. They are both mirrored in the wavy glass of an old mirror, so the corners of the room appear twisted. He stands beside him, hands clasped. The man kneels beside the boy, peering into his eyes. The boy twists and nods at him. The man stands and scratches his chin again. He's curled backward, ears to his knees. The boy raises his chin. The boy moves to the door. Outside in the shade, children are lounging in a garden with a low wooden barricade. A cylindrical barrel with silver stripes is balanced on the edge of a fountain facing him. Children dash past the fountain, as the boy drifts gently towards it, holding on to the railing for balance as he descends the three ramps into the garden. He perches on the fountain and lifts the silver drum with his left arm, unwinds the blue thread around it, and peels at the fabric. Inside is a green metal tin. The boy pries off the lid, unfolds green velvet padding, and gazes upward. In the tin is a jigsaw, turned sideways. Very cautiously, the boy flips the jigsaw over on its bed of green velvet. The cover depicts a daring character in a red cloak battling a giant-sized being, half-warrior, half-bird, against a background of London castles. The man reclines gently beside the boy. The boy keeps gazing upward at the jigsaw. He averts his eyes and back at him. He peeks up at him for a second. As he lowers his gaze again, the lines and shapes sharpen, revealing a more complex monochrome detail of the jigsaw cover. The light-haired teenager in a jacket and hoodie, whose visage is mirrored in the glass above the painting, shakes his head. The teenager chuckles. Elijah tiptoes across the theater using a crutch. Elijah spins back to glance at the teenager. As he does, David marches towards the theater with Joseph a few strides behind. Inside, Elijah is gliding away from the entrance and doesn't turn around. Elijah swivels. They're lounging in a lounge. Joseph squints up at his brother. Joseph shifts his gaze from David to Elijah, then stands and departs. Elijah, in a glittery, emerald, cotton outfit, stares at David. David gazes around as Joseph returns. David is lying down on a couch, a cushion beneath his back, browsing the magazine. Joseph is awake, sitting beside him, his head on David's shoulder, one foot draped over him. David raises the magazine and peers at his sibling. He closes the magazine and very gently slides away from the resting boy.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The cat's tail curls up, and it prowls noiselessly, glancing vaguely to the side. Above it, the window slides open, and a turtle slithers in. It pauses, shell in view, then slithers toward it. They are both mirrored in the shiny surface of a new laptop, so the corners of the garden appear warped. It stands beside it, legs crossed. The turtle leaps beside the cat, peering into its eyes. The cat spins and glares at it. It hops and crosses its legs again. It’s sprawled backward, ears up. The cat stretches its paws. The cat climbs to the roof. Inside in the moonlight, robots are weaving in a garage with a low barbed-wire gate. A round parcel with orange wrapping is perched on the roof of a car facing it. Robots roll past the car, as the cat prances quickly toward it, gripping on to the railing for balance as it skips the three steps up into the garage. It perches on the roof and picks up the orange parcel with its fine left paw, unties the red string over it, and claws at the covering. Within is a white plastic crate. The cat peels off the lid, flips over orange fabric, and peers up. In the crate is a map, right side up. Very hesitantly, the cat flips the map over on its pad of orange fabric. The sheet displays a mystical land with a green mountain battling a fragile ocean, all against a horizon of Parisian monuments. The turtle hops lightly beside the cat. The cat continues to peer up at the map. It gazes away and back at it. It glances down at it for an instant. As it peers up again, the images and patterns darken, leaving a more elaborate colored version of the map's sheet. The tall giraffe in a tuxedo and bow tie, whose paw is mirrored in the metal under the sketch, shakes. The giraffe chuckles. Martha dashes beside the sculpture using a stick. Martha spins forward to peer up at the sculpture. As she prances, Robert skips beside the sculpture with George several steps ahead. Outside, Martha is skipping closer to the window and doesn’t glance behind. Martha spins. They're dancing in a mansion. George peers up at his uncle. George glances from Robert to Martha, then skips down and hops. Martha, in a glittering, orange, cotton robe, scans at Robert. Robert peers forward as George hops away. Robert is lying down on a mat, a pillow under his legs, sketching the canvas. George is awake, sitting beside him, his leg on Robert's back, one hand draped over him. Robert raises the canvas and glimpses at his nephew. He opens the canvas and very hesitantly slides up from over the resting cat.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: The boy sulks, staring blankly ahead, until a woman enters the room, standing beside him with folded arms. He goes to the window and sees children playing outside. He moves towards a bench with a purple-wrapped package, supported by a chain-link fence. Sitting on the bench, he unwraps the package to find a comic book with a heroic figure on the cover. The woman joins him, and as he examines the comic, it transforms into a detailed black-and-white version. A young man, Elijah, limps across a gallery with a cane. As David strides towards the gallery with Joseph, they find Elijah in an office. Joseph, observing the two men, leaves but later returns to his father, David, who is reading in bed. David gently slips away from the sleeping Joseph.

test_cases.name: Reverse Segments Order
test_cases.description: He closes the paper and very carefully slides out from under the sleeping boy David lowers the paper and glances at his son Joseph is asleep lying across him his head on David's chest one arm flung around him David is sitting up on a bed a pillow behind his head reading the paper David looks around as Joseph returns Elijah in a shimmering purple silk suit gazes at David Joseph looks from David to Elijah then gets up and goes Joseph gazes up at his father They are sitting in an office Elijah turns Elijah is walking away from the door and does not look around Inside David strides towards the gallery with Joseph a few paces behind As he does Elijah turns back to stare at the man Elijah limps across the gallery using a cane The young man grins The darkhaired young man in a suit and tie whose face is reflected in the glass over the drawing nods As he looks down again the words and colors fade leaving a more detailed black and white version of the comic cover He glances up at her for a moment She looks away and back at him The boy continues to stare down at the comic The woman sits gently beside the boy halfman halfbeast against a backdrop of New York skyscrapers The cover features a heroic figure in a yellow cape fighting a powerfully built creature Very carefully the boy turns the comic around on its bed of purple tissue In the box is a comic upside down The boy pulls off the lid folds back purple tissue paper and stares down Inside is a brown cardboard box He sits on the bench and picks up the purple package with his good right hand undoes the white ribbon around it and tears at the paper Children chase past the bench as the boy walks slowly towards it holding on to the fencing for support as he negotiates the two steps down into the park An oblong box with purple wrapping is propped on the seat of a bench facing him Outside in the sunshine children are playing in a park with a high chainlink fence The boy goes to the window The boy lifts his head He is hunched forward head down She stands and folds her arms again The boy turns and looks at her The woman crouches beside the boy looking into his face She stands beside him arms folded They are both reflected in the curved screen of an old TV so the edges of the room look distorted She pauses hands on hips then walks towards him Behind him the door opens and a woman enters The boy's mouth turns down and he sulks silently staring blankly ahead
